div.p:
The marryed married Sist.r Hanne Nelson
She wrote of herself: I am born in the County of
Sommerset the 24th of July 1706. Myn Vater was an
earnstnestly religious Man in the Church of Engl.
He brought me up according to the Law in a very hard
Manner, which was quite contrary to the Disposition of my
Mind. After his departing I marryed married & had A.o 44 at Bath
a Opportunity to hear the first time in my Life the Gospel
Soon
Hanne Nelson, page 2
Soon after I was in B.r Cennicks Society received & in a
Preaching over these Words: He that believeth on me, hath
everlasting Life: Our Saviour in his Deaths figur drew
before my Heart, that I a long time, not with standing
all the Waylayings which my Relations invented, my
happy Course pursued. But as I afterwats afterwards took part
on the Disputes & quarrels about the Doctrine of the
Brethren I lost by that my happy path of a poor
Siner Sinner; Till A.o 46 B.r & Sist.r Gussenbouer as I became
aquainted acquainted w.th B.r & Sist.r Gussenbouer at Bristol, where
my first Husband happy departed but left me in desolate
& depressed Circumstances. This obliged me that I without
Consens of the Brethren my 2.d Husband James Nelson
marryed married, & by that was several years excluded from their Fellowship.
But our dear Saviour let me not go astray but graciously
permitted to receive me the 6th Apr 1765 into the
Congregation & in the Month of October to admitt admit
me to the holy Comunion Communion. This was the greatest Feast Day & the 13 Augs.
for my Soul, where I enjoyd so many Blessing under the
Flock of God, it which I shall never forget in my Life!
So far She herself. She was at the Neight Night Watch on
the New Year the last Time in our Meeting. Since her Sickness
our Brethren & Sisters visited her very often & w.th Y Joy of
their Heart observed: How our Sav.r her by Nature so rough
Temper altered gradualy gradually in a Sinerlicke & melted Heart.
To Day She took Lieve Leave of her Husband as Sist.r Nyberg just stepd
into the Room to give her the Blessing of the Congregat.n She
called out: "Now dear Saviour, come, come soon!" & instantly
expired in the 57 Year of her Age.

The 15th Br. Nyberg went to Bath, where he heard B.r Rogers
preach for more then 200 Poeple People; & there spoke w.th two Ministers
of the engl. Church who agreed together to preach nothing else
but the Death of Christ. The 18th we were very thankfull thankful
to our Sav.r that he showd us the Means that we could help
a poor & oppressed Brother in his outward Affairs. The 20th Came
both M.r Weslys & Howel Harns to see us. The first excused them-
selves about the hard Expressions, in their last Book against us,
& endeaverd to lay the charge on the Corrector. The last
invited B.r Nyberg to make a Visit in his Compagnie Company through
Wales, where he shortly preached to a Auditory of ten thousand
Poeple People. To the Conclusion of this blessed Month toock took our dear
Saviour in his eternal Safety the 30th.
